IRS990.ActivityOrMissionDesc: RANDOLPH-MACON ACADEMY IS A COLLEGE-PREPARATORY SCHOOL USING MILITARY VALUES TO PREPARE QUALIFIED YOUNG PEOPLE FOR LEADERSHIP ROLES IN THE UNITED STATES AND AROUND THE WORLD.
IRS990.MissionDesc: RANDOLPH-MACON ACADEMY IS A COLLEGE-PREPARATORY SCHOOL USING MILITARY VALUES TO PREPARE QUALIFIED YOUNG PEOPLE FOR LEADERSHIP ROLES IN THE UNITED STATES AND AROUND THE WORLD.
IRS990.Desc: ALL PROGRAM SERVICE EXPENSES ARE DIRECTLY RELATED TO ACTIVITIES NECESSARY IN OPERATING A BOARDING EDUCATION INSTITUTION.

BusinessName.BusinessNameLine1Txt: WELLS FARGO VENDOR FINANCIAL SERVICES L

SupplementalInformationDetail.ExplanationTxt: THE ACADEMY'S ENDOWMENT FUND CONSISTS OF INVESTMENTS, TO BE HELD INDEFINITELY, THE INCOME FROM WHICH IS EXPENDABLE TO SUPPORT SCHOLARSHIPS FOR QUALIFYING STUDENTS AND OTHER SPECIFIED PROGRAMS.

THE ACADEMY IS EXEMPT FROM FEDERAL INCOME TAXES UNDER THE PROVISIONS OF SECTION 501(C)(3) OF THE INTERNAL REVENUE CODE. THE ACADEMY IS SUBJECT TO TAXES ON UNRELATED BUSINESS ACTIVITIES. THE ACADEMY GENERATED NO UNRELATED BUSINESS INCOME FOR THE YEARS ENDED JUNE 30, 2023 AND 2022. THE ACADEMY EVALUATES UNCERTAINTY IN INCOME TAX POSITIONS BASED ON A MORE-LIKELY-THAN-NOT RECOGNITION STANDARD. IF THAT THRESHOLD IS MET, THE TAX POSITION IS THEN MEASURED AT THE LARGEST AMOUNT THAT IS GREATER THAN 50% LIKELY OF BEING REALIZED UPON ULTIMATE SETTLEMENT. AS OF JUNE 30, 2023 AND 2022, THERE WERE NO ACCRUALS FOR UNCERTAIN TAX POSITIONS. IF APPLICABLE, THE ACADEMY RECORDS INTEREST AND PENALTIES AS A COMPONENT OF INCOME TAX EXPENSE. TAX YEARS FROM JUNE 30, 2021 THROUGH THE CURRENT YEAR REMAIN OPEN FOR EXAMINATION BY FEDERAL AND STATE TAX AUTHORITIES.
CHANGE IN VALUE OF SPLIT INTEREST AGREEMENTS 116,074.
ALL RADIO AND NEWSPAPER ADVERTISING DESCRIBE RANDOLPH-MACON AS NONDISCRIMINATORY.

IN ORDER TO RECEIVE FINANCIAL AID, FAMILIES FILL OUT A FINANCIAL AID APPLICATION AT SSSBYNAIS.ORG. THE WEBSITE LOOKS AT INCOME, EXPENSES, ASSETS, LIABILITIES, AND DETERMINES THE "ESTIMATED FAMILY CONTRIBUTION". BASED UPON THE ESTIMATED FAMILY CONTRIBUTIONS, THE ACADEMY AWARDS FINANCIAL AID. MOST SCHOLARSHIPS ARE AWARDED BASED UPON THE FINANCIAL NEED OF THE APPLICANTS, HOWEVER THERE ARE A FEW SCHOLARSHIPS THAT HAVE SPECIFIC CRITERIA (FOR EXAMPLE, A STUDENT CAN RECEIVE A SCHOLARSHIP IF HE/SHE IS A METHODIST, HIGH FLIGHT STUDENT OR A FALCON SCHOLAR). THE FINANCIAL AID SELECTION COMMITTEE INCLUDES THE ADMISSIONS DIRECTOR, DIRECTOR OF ADMISSIONS AND FINANCIAL AID, DIRECTOR OF DEVELOPMENT AND BUSINESS OFFICER.
AMONG OTHER BENEFITS, THE PRESIDENT RECEIVES HOUSING ALLOWANCE IN LIEU OF CAMPUS HOUSING.
THE ORGANIZATION RECEIVED A DONATION OF LAND AND IS REQUIRED TO HOLD THE PROPERTY FOR THREE YEARS.

SupplementalInformationDetail.FormAndLineReferenceDesc: FORM 990, PART VI, SECTION B, LINE 11B
SupplementalInformationDetail.ExplanationTxt: FORM 990 IS PROVIDED TO THE BOARD OF TRUSTEES PRIOR TO FILING WITH THE IRS.

SupplementalInformationDetail.FormAndLineReferenceDesc: FORM 990, PART VI, SECTION B, LINE 12C
SupplementalInformationDetail.ExplanationTxt: CONFLICTS OF INTEREST ARE REVIEWED ANNUALLY.

SupplementalInformationDetail.FormAndLineReferenceDesc: FORM 990, PART VI, SECTION B, LINE 15
SupplementalInformationDetail.ExplanationTxt: THE CEO'S SALARY IS COMPARED TO EXECUTIVE COMPENSATION SURVEYS AND WITH DATA TAKEN FROM PRIVATE, INDEPENDENT SCHOOLS 990'S ON WWW.GUIDESTAR.COM. THE R-MA BOARD OF TRUSTEES REVIEWS THE COMPARATIVE DATA AND SETS SALARY/BENEFITS OF THE CEO APPROXIMATELY EVERY 2-3 YEARS. SENIOR STAFF SALARIES ARE COMPARED AGAINST NAIS (NATIONAL ASSOCIATION OF INDEPENDENT SCHOOLS) SALARY SURVEYS. THESE SURVEYS ARE BASED ON BOTH A NATIONAL AND STATE-BY-STATE BASIS. THE R-MA FINANCIAL/AUDIT COMMITTEE REVIEWS THE DATA AND VIA THE BUDGET PROCESS, THE FULL BOARD OF TRUSTEES APPROVES THE SALARIES AND BENEFITS.

SupplementalInformationDetail.FormAndLineReferenceDesc: FORM 990, PART VI, SECTION C, LINE 19
SupplementalInformationDetail.ExplanationTxt: THE ACADEMY PROVIDES THE DOCUMENTS UPON REQUEST.
CHANGE IN VALUE OF SPLIT INTEREST AGREEMENTS 116,074.
THE ORGANIZATION HAD NO CHANGES TO ITS OVERSIGHT PROCESS OR SELECTION PROCESS DURING THE TAX YEAR.
